Reviews.Title: Beware - Do Not Buy From Wire4Less (sams distributions llc)
Reviews.Author: sooner111
Reviews.Content: Beware - If you are buying from Wire4Less (sams distributions llc) - you might end up getting a refurbished phone.That is what I got, and that is what I am returning.Amazon needs to discipline this "seller" as quickly as possible because I do not want any more customers being misled.- Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: M. Cox
Reviews.Content: It is quite difficult for the lay-person to figure out this "will it work on AT&T; 3G" thing. As another reviewer stated, the phone as advertised will not work on AT&T; 3G. However, the phone I purchased is actually sold through Wireless Experts. A day after the order was submitted, I received an email from Wireless Experts asking me to call them. I called and was informed asked if my intention was to use this phone with AT&T;, to which my reply was, Yes. The person at Wireless Experts told me the difference between the phones--which basically Amazon lists, but if you don't know what to exactly look for, then you won't know the difference (as I didn't). So, Wireless Experts upgraded my order to a Nexus S that is compatible with AT&T;'s 3G network--and a white one at that!About the phone, as the title of the review states, it is a great phone. The lack of a MicroSD card slot is really not as bad as what I thought it would be. The majority of files I would put on the phone would be music and pictures -- movies are reserved for my tablet. The phone is easily root-able as well as being easy to unlock the bootloader. If rooting your phone is your thing, and you happen to want to adjust processor speed, one thing I found out while using the SetCPU app (my use is for down-clocking the processor when the screen is off to help save battery) -- well, if you set a profile to down-clock the processor for screen off, DO NOT set the processor to its lowest setting in the profile settings. Doing so will cause your phone not to come back on when you attempt to turn the screen back on and you will have to remove and reinsert the battery to get the phone to come back on. I initially thought I had a defective phone and actually had an RMA set to return the phone, when I found out this little item by accident -- but at the right time! If you use the app, set the processor to 400MHz (400000 on the slider).The rest of the phone is standard Google fare. If you've had any Android phone before this, then this one is no different except for the fact that there is no manufacturer apps or user interface on the phone -- just plain Android, and I like that. Hopefully you would too.

Reviews.Title: false advertising
Reviews.Author: nicachel
Reviews.Content: unit arrived in time coz i paid for 2 days shipping,comes with the ff.,no original box instead they use carrying case from HTC mytouch phone,a manual with 11 pages on it,not even mentioned if it is for nexus s.replacement charger although is samsung but you'll know it's not the original.no earphone.replacement battery with no name or brand on it.dies within 7 hrs of standby,probably it will last a couple of hour if you use it.phone has no scratch or whatever,don't know if it's new or not,because there is no plastic protector on it which you can find in any brand new phone.i paid for a new phone because the adds say so,but instead i got this.wire4less shame on you!

Reviews.Title: shipped with non-OEM battery, htc box
Reviews.Author: Zachary Cheeley
Reviews.Content: i thought i was buying a new phone.  this is refurbished.  my only complaint is lack of an original box (resale value) and lack of an OEM battery.  it did ship with an HTC mytouch leather case, which is arguably an upgrade from the white cardboard nexus box.  the phone is free of defects, but is clearly refurbished.  i received the 9020t, which is the t-mobile version.  its apparently a crapshoot as to which one you receive.  seller was wire4less (sams distribution llc)*edit* 10/28/12oh and the phone is amazing by the way.  I love the nexus line.  I've been travelling in Eastern europe (used a turkish, greek, and georgian SIM with zero effort) and this phone works flawlessly everywhere, popping wifi hotspots is a particularly useful feature.  i derive a bit of smug joy watching other tourists become confused when their SIM asks for an international unlock code (Verizon/AT&T; phones are generally not international devices out of the box regardless of having "global" included in their marketing terminology).as i near the end of my year warranty, my battery life has fallen to less than 2 hours of screen-on use, while this was extended marginally by the 4.1.2 update, its absolutely unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: This is cheating
Reviews.Author: Kunju
Reviews.Content: This product is advertised as new and they are shipping a refurbished product with a third party battery (which can very well has the potential to harm the device) and missing headset. It says USA warranty, but being Refurbished it would be just 3 months compared to a year. I have sent mine back for refund and bought a new one (in real) from Negri Electronics for about $25 cheaper than this. I would have rated this 0 star if there was an option.

Reviews.Title: Tried my luck...
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on here I tried my luck and sure enough, I also received a remanufactured phone. It was not in the original packaging/boxes, not original battery, not original instruction booklet, and the sticker inside the battery compartment clearly says "Remanufactured." I'm not sure why Amazon is letting wire4less continue to deceive customers but needless to say, I am returning this item. Thanks for wasting my time, wire4less.

Reviews.Title: Terrible experience
Reviews.Author: Tarik Akyol
Reviews.Content: My friend purchased this phone for me from sams distributions llc at Amazon.com and he took it to me overseas. When I started using the phone I knew that there was something wrong with it. Battery died in about 4 hours after full charge. Even I leave it at night in airplane mode with 50% charge it dies in the morning. When I checked the battery compartment, I noticed that they changed the original battery with a cheap battery with no brand on it. Basically they sell the original batteries. I wonder what other parts of this phone they sent me are not original parts.Amazon simply needs to ban this company from selling any other product for doing this, it is not acceptable to see this kind of fraud companies here, selling non-original phones as new phones!

Reviews.Title: Not original package, missing battery and stuff
Reviews.Author: H. Wu "Code Shogun"
Reviews.Content: There's no battery in the package, no headset, no manual.And there's no original phone box either! It seems to be used/2nd hand phoneSimply terrible!

Reviews.Title: Fraud Company. Don't buy from Wire4Less
Reviews.Author: Frustated Customer
Reviews.Content: Don't buy from Wire4Less. They are fraud company. I bought a new phone with US warranty from them. But they sent me a refurbished phone with fake battery and without headset and without Warranty. I returned it and they again sent me a phone with fake battery and without warranty. Then I asked them for refund and they said they would refuned the whole amount. I returned the phone and waited for 2 weeks to hear from them but no body replied. In the mean while I bought a new phone from somewhere. And after 2 weeks and a lot of mails, I searched out their phone number to contact them. And then they charged me 80 dollars as restocking amount (even though they told me to refund whole amount). And after that they didn't respond to my mails and didn't pickup the phone and never returned my calls. Don't buy from Wire4Less. They are Crook.

Reviews.Title: Nexus S
Reviews.Author: NMMin
Reviews.Content: Prompt shipping & New product as advertised but item is missing OEM charger & earphones. No written warranty was included as well.

Reviews.Title: Wrong phones delivered
Reviews.Author: Gugelhupf
Reviews.Content: I ordered two of these phones on Amazon.com. The web page clearly advertises the phone model that works on the t-mobil frequencies. Trusting the truthfulness of the description, I ordered two of these phones as birthday gifts for my twin sisters. Today, I got delivery of two phones with model number GT-I9020A, i.e., phones that work on the AT&T; frequencies. Not the t-mobil frequencies.Another reviewer of this company noted that he was disappointed that he received t-mobil phones. Ironically, I would have been very happy to get t-mobil phones.Looking closer at the web page, I realize now that the description fits the t-mobile phone, but that the model number is incomplete. The correct model numbers are GT-I9020T (t-mobil) and GT-I9020A (AT&T;). The web page shows only GT-I9020, i.e., the suffix was dropped. Perhaps this was not accidental.I just filled out my return request, and I am still waiting for the response. I will update this review with more details on how this goes. I suspect that there next move will be to dupe me into the t-mobil version with cheap LCD screen (not the advertised Super Amoled screen).By the way, I have owned the t-mobil version of the Nexus S for more than a year. The Nexus S is an excellent phone. This is the reason I decided to get two of these phones as gifts. My low rating is based on the poor performance of this seller.

Reviews.Title: Does not come in originial packaging and does not have earphones
Reviews.Author: veldi
Reviews.Content: Hello All,Firstly, there's no problem with the device itself. But, the package that I received did not contain the proper retail packaging of samsung. It had a wall charger, USB connector, NO EARPHONES, phone and a 3 page booklet (being called as manual). I definitely think that there's something wrong with the packaging. I'm returning back the phone for two reasons:1) No earphones included2) Did not work with my TMobile dataplan (3G)RegardsVeldi

Reviews.Title: Poor phone in general, fake battery
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: This is a poor phone in general: Slow response from the UI, often have to restart the phone when GPS or data radios lock up inexplicably, and short battery life. Also, real battery is supposed to say "Samsung" on it, the one I bought on Amazon does not and is a fake; this battery is totally worthless as it only lasts about one hour in standby before you have to charge it again  (I later replaced it with a real Samsung battery and got about 10 hours of standby per charge). However, the other problems with the phone were too many, so I sold it and bought a Nexus 4 instead. I'm extremely pleased with the Nexus 4, definitely go for the 4 and avoid the Nexus S.

Reviews.Title: I guess new doesn't mean new anymore. Or has the definition changed?
Reviews.Author: L
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying this not a review of the phone. I can't review the phone since I returned it the next day, never even attempting to use it. My rating reflects my experience with the seller, HP Wireless. One star is too high, but that's the minimum possible.The phone was advertised as new. To me that means never used, usually unopened, and everything the manufacturer originally packaged with the item is included. The box had obviously been opened before I received it. With so many sellers opening packaging, "for inspection," whatever that means (well, we know what that means), I was willing to overlook the opened box. However, upon examining the contents, it was obvious this was not a new item. The battery door was not even included, the battery was some unknown non-OEM brand, and there were two sets of earphones, one definitely not OEM. Maybe they included the extra earphones so I wouldn't notice the missing battery door.Be very wary of third-party sellers. There's no way to tell which ones are crooks. From reading other reviews, it's apparent there are plenty of them out there, including this seller.

Reviews.Title: What a shame!
Reviews.Author: A. Mejia "Al"
Reviews.Content: Beautiful telephone, outstanding operating system, huge apps selection. A telephone with a battery that dies in less than three hours without being in use is useless as a portable telephone; that's a shame.I unplugged the phone from the charger fully charged at seven AM. Somebody called me on the land line at ten AM asking why I was not answering my cellular. It never rang and therefore I did not answer and I do not know how long the charge really lasted, but it was much less than three hours. There are many comments about short lived battery charge, but this is ridiculous.Amazon was nice in accepting a return after three plus months from the purchase date, but I am livid because the seller sent me a defective item and they charge me a restocking fee of 20%. For the first time in more than twenty years as an Amazon client, I feel ripped off. A defective item should have a 100% refund when returned.

Reviews.Title: Good phone, wrong product description.
Reviews.Author: Scambloch
Reviews.Content: Got the phone even after the reviews, so I knew what was being bought. Set to two stars for seller's lack of honesty, which clearly stated the product as NEW on the description. Apart from that, phone looks good and so far works fine. I hope they also honor the U.S. Warranty stated on the title.

Reviews.Title: don't expect factory seal
Reviews.Author: Dat
Reviews.Content: The phone works fine - the gps is not as accurate as the Nexus One made by HTC.I was reluctant to buy a phone from Wire4less after reading all the reviews.  I did not received a new factory phone.  The phone itself appears new, but it did not have the original seal box.  It came with a mytouch (tmobile brand) zipper box, third party battery and oem SAMSUNG charger and cable.  Overall, I am content with the purchase.For those that are having a hard time trying to figure out if it works with ATT or TMOBILE, here's two way to tell:1.  3G bands from descriptions.  1700/2100 is for TMOBILE and 1900/2100 is for ATT2.  Under "more buying choices" - click on "used and new", the seller usually explicitly tells which version it is and a complete model number.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware! Model number incomplete
Reviews.Author: Ryan McDougall
Reviews.Content: I read the review complaining the user got the GT-I9020T which would only work on T-Mobile (which is what I wanted). I assumed perhaps too much, and ended up receiving a GT-I9020A instead. I now have a phone that is useless to me which I have to fight to get a return on. Even if I they will give me the GT-I9020T in return I'll be without a phone while everything is shipping.Bottom line: Misleading advertising or horrible customer communication, either way don't bother doing business with this seller.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: namdie
Reviews.Content: I had doubts before purchasing this product, but my doubts failed me. The Phone came as described by the seller and was in perfect condition. it was working fine during the period i used it, but after 6 months it switched off and refused to turn on. and the warranty did not help because it was an international version.

Reviews.Title: IT IS BETTER
Reviews.Author: Okyere Seth
Reviews.Content: The phone has no fault and has the same applications as the nexus 4. It did not show any scratches at the back. I really like it.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: Shane Denton
Reviews.Content: The phone was in incredible shape, not a scratch on it.  Just fyi, the phone is actually a i9020a which is at&t; network only so it can't be used on T-Mobile.

Reviews.Title: Doesnt work properly
Reviews.Author: Sergiov
Reviews.Content: The phone doesnt work properly. Only navegates in edge mode and battery drains in less than 5 hours.Please DONT buy it

Reviews.Title: The Best Android phone
Reviews.Author: Atit "AtitShah"
Reviews.Content: I have this phone and bought from Amazon since sometime back in 2011. Definitely, the best phone in Android and after ICS update, there is not much difference in Galaxy Nexus phone. Though, price of both the phones are now same as 'Android Play Store' is selling Galaxy Nexus for the same price $399.

Reviews.Title: The phone is ok, but battery sucks
Reviews.Author: Gustavo M. Souza
Reviews.Content: The phone until now lucks ok, no problems, but the battery runs out in 6 or 7 hours. Almost a desktop with touch screen.

Reviews.Title: Defected battery
Reviews.Author: J. Wu
Reviews.Content: Phone was fine. I got it a month ago.But today and yesterday, the battery caused quite a lot of problems.I have to conclude that the battery is defected. Not to mention that the battery has no brand on it whatsoever.Yesterday, when my phone has 80% battery capacity left, I turned off the screen and put in my pocket. 1 hour later, my phone died so I had to be without a phone for half a day.Today, even worse. Battery capacity went from 64% to 14% in just 15 mins.Note that I did not even have wifi on during this whole time. Furthermore, it is not possible for a phone to consume that much power in this short period of time even with all features turned on.Very unsatisfied with the battery. Apart from that, product and shipping is good.

Reviews.Title: Well Satisfied Customer
Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: My phone is in mint condiditon.I live in The Bahamas. I waited an agonizing 2 weeks for its arrival. I ordered it on the 3rd of Feb and its finally here!It was well packaged and came with a cute pocket book that can hold all of the phone accessories as well as the phone.I wish I was able to view the accessories that came with it when I purchased it. I ordered extras but thats fine.I am really enjoying my new Samsung Nexus S!Thanks guys! The wait paid off tremendously!

Reviews.Title: wire4less is a cheat!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Baig
Reviews.Content: I bought a new Samsung nexus s this from "wire4less" on Feb 5th 2012, its not even 10 months my mobile is dead now,I went to servicing center they are saying that mother board is dead, it will cost 200$ for the service.And even i found that the battery he gave me is not genuine, It don't have any Samsung label as it does on all other Samsung devices do .and its not working and i see swelling with it.  i got to buy another battery will cost me another 30$So it cost me almost the same as the mobile cost $230 to get it work. This seller sucks they are cheaters.don't buy anything from this buyer at all.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: mew "MEW"
Reviews.Content: Love my new GT-I1920T! It's a little late in the game, but it's the right size for pocket storage, the amoled screen is a pleasure. I am not high tech and this phone was cinch to set up although it had such a large update that it was time consuming. Worth the trouble. I like the fact that I can remove the apps I don't want on the home screen too. Smart and Simple. Good combo for me.  It is indeed a T-mobile version of the 1920. Before I ordered I contacted the seller to confirm. Samsung GT - i9020 Google Nexus S - Unlocked Phone - US Warranty (Black)

Reviews.Title: Good phone , but started to show its age
Reviews.Author: Mohammed
Reviews.Content: Very advance phone when it was released in Dec. 2010 ... But now in 2012 , networks started to have hogher data speeds and this phone has a data speed limit of around 7 mbit/sec ... Which is the max of most 3G networks . And the modern trend nowadays is the 4G speeds.. If you need something faster in data go with the Galaxy SII or better....Screen is excellen with vivd colors and sharp details...simply Samsung qualityBuild quality is very goodDevice speed and responsiveness is OK but not mind blowing fast !! especially nowadyasCamera is excellent for a cell phone both in stil pic or videosApps compatibility is very good..Most apps would workHas the potential to have all the new updates cause it's a Google deviceWill work only with T Mobile 3G data (NOT AT&T;) but can make calls OK with any GSM networkThat's pretty much it..Thanks

Reviews.Title: cool smart phone, but a bit bad on the service of registration.
Reviews.Author: icnewer
Reviews.Content: The phone is cool and I like it, the delivery is also good even I requested to deliver the goods to my friend's hotel. However I don't know why I can't register this phone at Samsung's website per Google's link, though I don't use it at US but in Malaysia instead. I contact both Amazon & Wireless Everything, but no solution & feedback till to today.

Reviews.Title: BEWARE, ONLY WORKS WITH T-MOBILE 3G NOT AT&T;
Reviews.Author: AKMAC
Reviews.Content: While the phone was unlocked as advertised, it ONLY WORKS WITH T-MOBILE 3G SERVICE. If you are using AT&T;, you will be STUCK WITH EDGE. The company would NOT even respond to my inquiry about returning the product. All communication was going fine back and forth with the company until I asked about their return policy, at which time they would not even return my email.ONLY BUY IF USING WITH T-MOBILE.

Reviews.Title: I am so pleased, It is the I9020 no kiding
Reviews.Author: S. A. hashimi
Reviews.Content: I dont need to talk about the phone becase there are 1000s reviews about it in the youtube and other websitesthe best thing this the best model among the nexus s family I9020saler was very nice and as soon as Iv aske for tracking info he did sent it to me next dayprice is goodcharger 240-110 for me is good because i over seasAndroid OS going to open a lot of options to you ,you can only buy cheap apps from AmazonVS IPhone I will say I saved up to 400$ + more fun + I dont have to buy thing from samsung or others I am free to choose what i whant, not as ApL they force to bay ( Itune ,I....,I,,,) .

Reviews.Title: Still a good phone in 2012, with some minor cons
Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: Short and sweet review:I purchased a like new, unlocked version of this phone for $200 - an EXCELLENT deal - in July 2012 because I was ready to make the full switch to Android, but I just didn't have the money for a Galaxy Nexus. You might want to get yourself a nice little case if you ever drop the thing, as well as an additional charger (maybe a car charger) because this battery drains pretty fast. I might be able to go a full day with about 30% battery to spare at the end of the day, but that's ONLY when I sparingly use the device and listen to Google Play Music for roughly two hours or so.In spite of battery drain, I am immensely enjoying the phone. I love all of the Google services that are connected to the device; I love that when I brought it I was one of the few that had Android 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich off the bat, and now I'm one of the FEWER that has Android 4.1 Jelly Bean. Now ironically, I'd be surprised if I get the next version of Android, because even with Google's "Project Butter", there is still a bit of lag within Chrome, as well as lag when I open and close a few apps. Most of the top notch Android phones these days have 1GB of RAM, and I certainly see the necessity of that as 512MB of RAM (which this phone has) can cause some hiccups on streaming playback which is a nuisance, but hasn't soured me on both the Android and phone experience.Quite frankly, when going for an Android device - either high end or low end - I'd have to recommend to do your research on the pros and cons of what you are looking for. I say this because even though I'm enjoying this phone, many have said that I also have the "patience of Job (biblical character)", and I could see the frequent "pops" during music streaming playback greatly annoying a listener. Also, if you're not deeply ingrained in many of Google's services, you might find it hard to enjoy it or even switch from another service (such as iOS/Apple). Personally, I came from an iPhone 3GS and an iPad, but it was a seamless transition because Google+ backs up all of my photos, all 80GB of my music is on Google Play, and fortunately many of the apps I used on iOS are either on Google's Play Store or there is an Android alternative. I'm not sure if I would recommend this - or any Android phone - to my parents just yet. My biggest concern is the battery drain and I'd have to research a phone that can last a full day without major drain; and that is the key for any person shopping for Android - RESEARCH.I don't know if I'll have this phone by this time next year - hopefully I'll be able to afford the latest Nexus coming out at the end of 2012; or maybe the Galaxy Nexus will be just as wise of a purchase in 2013 as the Nexus S was for me this year in 2012. Either way, I am extremely pleased with my purchase, especially since this is my first Android device and leaves me with an overall positive experience.

Reviews.Title: Received a  refurbished unit
Reviews.Author: pointillistic
Reviews.Content: The phone is no new, it is refurbished. And the seller should state this fact clearly.Missing:1. Original box.2. Headphones.3. Nexus S comes with 1500 mAh battery, while this phone has 1440 mAh battery. The phone needs to be constantly recharged.

Reviews.Title: good phone bad battery
Reviews.Author: samsung nerd
Reviews.Content: i got this phone 3 month's ago and i have been loven it except the battery. I can not make it a day with moderate use. I can swing it if i am lite on my use. if you what a cheep phone with android 4.0 it is good gust don't get this if you need to make it a long time without charging. if you are on Verizon then i would recommend the motorola droid razr maxx. if you are on at&t; or t-mobile i would pay more for the Samsung galaxy s2. It has better battery and better processor then the nexes s exe. Over all the nexus s is a good phone with stock android but the droid razr maxx or the galaxy s2 is a better choice then the nexus s but if you what the cheaper phone then the nexus s will work fine.

Reviews.Title: WORST PRODUCT EVER
Reviews.Author: Ben Watson "huntertom"
Reviews.Content: This phone is an absolute peice of garbage. BE WISE AND DO NOT BUY. Everything on it is glitchy and prone to failure. Recently, the power button stopped working and I'm now going to have to purchase a new phone. Check the forum threads, this is not an uncommon issue. You might as well buy a fisher price walkie talkie from walmart; you'd be getting better value.

Reviews.Title: Precise details required
Reviews.Author: MaxEdge
Reviews.Content: I need precise details of the phone.1. Does is really come with AMOLED? dont fool with LCD2. International warranty? Will be using it in India.3. Carrier support? Will it be supported on GSM carriers like Vodafone, Airtel, BSNL from India?Thanks in advance, expecting a reply ASAP.Regards,

ProductInfo.Features:
This unlocked cell phone will work on GSM carries like AT&T; and T-Mobile. Not all carrier features may be supported.
Unlocked Quad-Band GSM cell phone compatible with 850/900/1800/1900MHz and 3G HSDPA 900/1700/2100 frequencies plus GPRS/EDGE data capabilities.
Android OS, v2. 3 Gingerbread; 5 MP Camera, 2560 x 1920 pixels, autofocus, LED flash, Geo-tagging, touch focus
Bluetooth v2. 1 with A2DP; Social networking integration
Talk time up to 14 hours - Standby up to 700 hours. Flash Player v10. 1,  Google Search, Maps, Gmail, YouTube, Calendar, Google Talk,
Near Field Communications; Document editor (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, PDF) and Internal 16GB storage.
Super AMOLED capacitive touchscreen, 16M colors, Wi-Fi 802. 11 b/g/n, DLNA, GPS with A-GPS support and Google 3D Maps.
Talk time up to 14 hours - Standby up to 700 hours.
Talk time up to 14 hours - Standby up to 700 hours. Flash Player v10. 1,  Google Search, Maps, Gmail, YouTube, Calendar, Google Talk
This unlocked cell phone will work on GSM carries like AT&T; and T-Mobile. Not all carrier features may be supported
Unlocked Quad-Band GSM cell phone compatible with 850/900/1800/1900MHz and 3G HSDPA 900/1700/2100 frequencies plus GPRS/EDGE data capabilities
ProductInfo.Name: Samsung Google Nexus S - Unlocked GSM Phone International Version/Warranty 3G Bands 900/1700/2100
